meanings.definition: The state or quality of being a lord.
meanings.sent1: In the story, the character's lordship was evident through his grand castle.
meanings.sent2: The king's lordship over the land was unquestioned by his subjects.
meanings.sent3: The duck claimed lordship over the pond, much to the amusement of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her lordship of the dance floor was unmatched, gliding effortlessly with each step.
meanings.sent5: The lordship of the forest was bestowed upon the wise old owl, who watched over all creatures.

meanings.definition: The authority or power of a lord.
meanings.sent1: The knight respected the lord's lordship and followed his commands without question.
meanings.sent2: The lord's lordship allowed him to make important decisions for the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The cat asserted its lordship over the house by claiming the comfiest spot on the couch.
meanings.sent4: His lordship in the courtroom was evident as he delivered a fair judgment.
meanings.sent5: The lordship of the sea belonged to Poseidon, who controlled the waves with his trident.

meanings.definition: The title or dignity of a lord.
meanings.sent1: The ceremony marked the bestowal of his lordship upon the humble farmer.
meanings.sent2: The lordship's elegant attire and regal demeanor commanded respect from all who met him.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel humorously declared lordship over the nut stash, much to the confusion of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her lordship of the court was evident as she presided over the legal proceedings with grace.
meanings.sent5: The lordship of the skies belonged to the majestic eagle, soaring high above the treetops.
